sections.title: Introduction
sections.summary: These Terms govern the use of Fixnado’s marketplace, workflow, and communication tools by service providers and clients across the United Kingdom.

clauses.heading: Welcome to Fixnado
content: Fixnado is an intelligent marketplace operated by Blackwellen Ltd, a company registered in England and Wales under company number 13847592. These Terms and Conditions ("Terms") set out the legally binding agreement between Blackwellen Ltd ("Fixnado", "we", "us") and any person or organisation who accesses or uses our website, mobile applications, application programming interfaces, or related services (collectively the "Platform").

By creating an account, browsing our listings, engaging with our concierge team, or commissioning work through Fixnado, you confirm that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by these Terms. The Platform enables clients to identify, evaluate, and contract with independent service providers ("Providers") who deliver repairs, maintenance, installation, and specialist field services. Fixnado is not itself a contractor or employer of Providers; rather, we operate a regulated marketplace and workflow infrastructure that connects professional Providers with enterprise and residential clients.
If you do not agree to these Terms, you must refrain from using the Platform. Continued use indicates acceptance of the most recent version published on our website.

clauses.heading: Contractual structure
content: When a client and a Provider confirm a job through the Platform, a direct contract is formed between those parties on the commercial terms they have agreed. Fixnado acts as a disclosed agent facilitating introductions, escrow management, scheduling, and compliance support. We do not supervise, direct, or control the manner in which Providers deliver services, and Providers remain solely responsible for statutory compliance, insurances, and workmanship standards.

These Terms apply alongside any service-specific annexes, operational manuals, or policy updates issued by Fixnado. In the event of inconsistency between these Terms and a bespoke written agreement signed by a director of Blackwellen Ltd, the bespoke agreement prevails to the extent of the conflict. Nothing in these Terms limits mandatory consumer protections that may apply when clients act as consumers under UK law.

items: Providers contract directly with clients for the scope, price, and timeline of each job.
Fixnado provides platform, payment, vetting, and support services but does not deliver the underlying works.
These Terms apply in addition to any job-specific statement of work, purchase order, or service level agreement.

sections.title: Definitions
sections.summary: Clear definitions are provided so that parties understand their rights and obligations without ambiguity.

clauses.heading: Key defined terms
content: In these Terms, the following expressions have the meanings set out below unless the context requires otherwise:

"Account" means the secure profile created by a Provider or client to access the Platform. "Affiliate" includes any parent undertaking, subsidiary, or entity that controls or is under common control with a party. "Business Day" means Monday to Friday other than public holidays in England and Wales. "Client" refers to any individual, business, or public body procuring services through Fixnado. "Confidential Information" encompasses any non-public information disclosed in connection with these Terms. "Intellectual Property Rights" include patents, trade marks, rights in designs, database rights, and copyright whether registered or not. "Provider" means an independent professional or company offering services via the Platform after passing our onboarding checks. "Service Fees" refers to the commissions, subscription fees, or transactional charges payable to Fixnado. "Work Order" means the digital record generated through the Platform confirming scope, price, and milestones.

Any reference to a statute or statutory provision includes that statute or provision as amended, re-enacted, or replaced from time to time. Words in the singular include the plural and vice versa. Headings are for convenience only and do not affect interpretation.

clauses.heading: Hierarchy and incorporation
content: Supplemental product schedules, data processing appendices, insurance warranties, and any platform notices referenced in a Work Order form part of these Terms. If we introduce new modules, we may issue updated definitions or annexes. Continued use of those modules constitutes acceptance of the updated documentation.

sections.title: Account Eligibility and Verification
sections.summary: This section sets out the eligibility requirements and verification processes to maintain marketplace integrity.

clauses.heading: Eligibility criteria
content: You must be at least 18 years old and legally capable of entering into binding contracts in the United Kingdom to create an Account. Providers must hold any licences, accreditations, or trade body memberships legally required for the services they offer. Clients procuring on behalf of a company warrant that they have authority to bind that company to these Terms.

We reserve the right to refuse, suspend, or terminate any Account where eligibility criteria are not met or where we reasonably believe that onboarding the applicant would pose a risk to the integrity of the Platform, other users, or Fixnado’s reputation. Background vetting may include identity checks, criminal record searches (where lawful), credit assessments, reference verification, and insurance audits.

clauses.heading: Know-your-business safeguards
content: Providers must supply documentary evidence of trading status, insurance, qualifications, and tax registration upon request. Fixnado may engage external verification partners subject to robust data processing agreements. You agree to respond promptly to due diligence queries and keep submitted documents up to date. Failure to do so may result in suspension, withdrawal of leads, or withholding of payments until compliance is restored.

Clients using purchase orders or embedded enterprise procurement integrations must maintain accurate billing data, VAT numbers, and approval hierarchies. We may request confirmation of authority levels or delegated procurement policies before enabling enterprise features.

items: Identity documents must be clear, valid, and match the Account holder’s legal name.
Insurance certificates must show policy limits, territorial coverage, and renewal dates.

sections.title: Using the Fixnado Platform
sections.summary: Guidelines for secure, fair, and professional use of Fixnado’s digital tools.

clauses.heading: Access control and security
content: You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your login credentials and for all activities conducted under your Account. Multi-factor authentication is mandatory for administrative roles and strongly recommended for all other users. You must promptly notify us at security@fixnado.co.uk if you suspect unauthorised access, credential compromise, or other security incidents.

The Platform includes dashboards, messaging, geolocation, AI-assisted estimates, and digital signatures. You agree not to misuse these tools, introduce malicious code, scrape data, or attempt to bypass access controls. We may monitor usage patterns, audit API calls, and implement rate limits to maintain service stability.

clauses.heading: Professional conduct
content: Providers must deliver services with the degree of skill and care expected from experienced professionals in their trade. All communications through Fixnado’s messaging tools must remain respectful, non-discriminatory, and factual. Bullying, harassment, or the distribution of illegal, defamatory, or infringing content is strictly prohibited.

You must not use Fixnado to engage in unlicensed activities, facilitate money laundering, or solicit clients or Providers outside the Platform for the purpose of avoiding Service Fees. We may suspend or terminate Accounts involved in off-platform circumvention, fraudulent conduct, or the dissemination of misleading representations.

sections.title: Provider Obligations
sections.summary: Providers must meet high operational standards, maintain insurance, and comply with all relevant regulations.

clauses.heading: Professional standards and compliance
content: Providers warrant that they, and any subcontractors they engage, are suitably qualified, resourced, and equipped to deliver each Work Order safely and lawfully. This includes compliance with the Construction (Design and Management) Regulations 2015, the Provision and Use of Work Equipment Regulations 1998, Gas Safe or NICEIC requirements where applicable, and any local licensing obligations.

Providers must supply risk assessments, method statements, and material safety data sheets when requested by a client or Fixnado. You agree to cooperate with site induction requirements, safeguarding protocols, and environmental policies, including waste disposal and recycling mandates. Where permits, parking dispensations, or road closures are required, the Provider must ensure they are obtained in advance unless the Work Order specifies otherwise.

clauses.heading: Insurance and indemnity
content: Providers must maintain at least £5 million public liability insurance, £10 million employers’ liability insurance (where applicable), and professional indemnity insurance commensurate with the services offered. Evidence of insurance must be uploaded to the Platform and updated before expiry. Fixnado may suspend lead allocation if policies lapse or limits fall below mandated thresholds.

Providers indemnify Fixnado against losses, claims, and costs arising from their breach of these Terms, negligence, wilful misconduct, or infringement of third-party rights. This indemnity does not extend to losses caused by Fixnado’s own negligence or breach.

items: Notify Fixnado immediately of any incident that could give rise to an insurance claim.
Use only competent subcontractors who hold equivalent insurances and trade accreditations.

sections.title: Client Obligations
sections.summary: Clients must provide accurate information, ensure safe access, and pay invoices promptly.

clauses.heading: Information accuracy and cooperation
content: Clients must supply accurate property information, job specifications, and contact details. You are responsible for ensuring that permissions, landlord approvals, or planning consents are in place where required. Clients must provide safe access to sites, including disclosing known hazards such as asbestos, electrical defects, or security systems.

You agree to engage with scheduling requests, milestone approvals, and verification steps through the Platform. Delays caused by inaccurate information or failure to cooperate may result in rescheduling charges, demobilisation fees, or loss of deposits as detailed in the relevant Work Order.

clauses.heading: Payment obligations
content: Clients must pay all invoices, deposits, and variation orders in accordance with the agreed payment terms. Where escrow is utilised, funds must be deposited before work commences and will be released upon milestone approval. If a client disputes an invoice, they must raise a formal dispute via the Platform within seven calendar days, providing evidence to support the challenge.

Late payment interest accrues at 4% per annum above the Bank of England base rate, calculated daily, until the outstanding sums are settled. Fixnado reserves the right to suspend project workflows or restrict account functionality where invoices remain overdue.

sections.title: Fees, Subscriptions, and Taxes
sections.summary: Transparent fee schedules and tax responsibilities for all parties.

clauses.heading: Service fees
content: Fixnado may charge Providers transaction commissions, lead reservation fees, or subscription charges for premium features. The applicable rates are displayed within the Provider dashboard and may vary by service category, location, or job value. Changes to fee schedules will be communicated with at least 30 days’ notice unless the change arises from regulatory requirements or the introduction of a new optional feature.
Clients may incur booking fees, cancellation charges, or concierge support fees where bespoke procurement, compliance,. All Service Fees are quoted exclusive of VAT unless expressly stated otherwise.

clauses.heading: Taxes and reporting
content: Providers are responsible for calculating, collecting, and remitting any taxes, duties, or levies arising from the services they supply. Fixnado does not provide tax advice. We may provide transactional summaries to assist with record keeping, but you should seek independent professional advice to ensure compliance with HMRC requirements.
Where required by law, Fixnado may report transactional data to tax authorities or regulators.

sections.title: Payments, Escrow, and Disputes
sections.summary: Funds flow through regulated partners and disputes are resolved via structured escalation.

clauses.heading: Escrow service
content: Fixnado partners with FCA-regulated payment institutions to hold client funds in safeguarded accounts until milestones are approved. Clients authorise Fixnado to instruct the release of escrowed funds when Provider deliverables have been accepted or deemed accepted under these Terms. Providers acknowledge that release of funds is conditional on milestone approval and may be delayed if supporting evidence is requested.

clauses.heading: Dispute escalation
content: If a party wishes to dispute workmanship, scope variations, or delays, they must lodge a written notice through the Platform within seven calendar days of the relevant milestone. The notice must include photographic evidence, site reports, and proposed remedies. Fixnado will facilitate a structured resolution pathway comprising: (1) collaborative review between parties, (2) Fixnado case manager evaluation, and (3) independent adjudication or mediation if unresolved.

While a dispute is pending, funds remain in escrow unless a safety-critical repair must proceed. In such cases, Fixnado may release up to 50% of the disputed amount to cover necessary works, subject to independent verification. Providers must continue to cooperate with investigations and implement remedial actions agreed through the dispute process.

items: Stage one: collaborative review aiming to resolve within three Business Days.
Stage two: Fixnado case manager determination issued within five Business Days of receiving all evidence.
Stage three: referral to mediation, adjudication, or expert determination under the Housing Grants, Construction and Regeneration Act 1996 where applicable.

sections.title: Cancellations and Refunds
sections.summary: Rules governing cancellations, rescheduling, and refunds for both Providers and clients.

clauses.heading: Client-initiated cancellations
content: Clients may cancel a Work Order via the Platform. If cancellation occurs more than 48 hours before the scheduled start time, any prepaid funds (less non-refundable booking fees) will be returned within seven Business Days. Cancellations within 48 hours may incur a charge equal to the Provider’s documented mobilisation costs plus any materials already procured. Emergency call-outs cancelled within two hours of confirmation are fully chargeable unless the Provider agrees otherwise in writing.

Where the Consumer Contracts (Information, Cancellation and Additional Charges) Regulations 2013 apply, consumers retain statutory cancellation rights for distance contracts. By requesting immediate commencement of urgent works, consumers acknowledge that their statutory right to cancel may be lost once the service is fully performed.

clauses.heading: Provider-initiated cancellations
content: Providers should avoid cancelling confirmed Work Orders. If unavoidable circumstances arise, the Provider must notify the client and Fixnado immediately via the Platform, providing reasons and evidence. Repeated cancellations may result in reduced marketplace visibility, temporary suspension, or liability for direct losses incurred by the client in sourcing an alternative Provider.

Fixnado may assist in reallocating the job to an alternative Provider. Any prepaid sums will transfer to the replacement Provider once the client approves the substitution. Providers acknowledge that failure to attend site without notice may trigger compensation claims for wasted costs and service credits owed to the client.

sections.title: Ratings, Reviews, and Feedback
sections.summary: How feedback is collected, moderated, and used to uphold quality standards.

clauses.heading: Submission guidelines
content: Clients may leave ratings and qualitative feedback after each Work Order. Reviews must be honest, based on firsthand experience, and comply with UK defamation and consumer protection laws. We prohibit reviews containing hate speech, personal data beyond what is necessary, or promotional content. Providers may respond publicly to reviews to offer context, provided responses remain professional and respectful.

Fixnado employs moderation tools and may remove or edit reviews that breach these guidelines. We do not alter feedback simply because a party dislikes its substance; however, we may suppress reviews pending investigation into factual disputes. Aggregated ratings influence Provider rankings and eligibility for enterprise programmes.

clauses.heading: Use of feedback
content: By submitting a review, you grant Fixnado a perpetual, royalty-free licence to publish, reproduce, and distribute the content across our marketing channels, case studies, and analytics dashboards. We may anonymise data for benchmarking while preserving confidentiality obligations. Providers may not use reviews obtained via Fixnado to imply Fixnado’s endorsement of services beyond the specific engagements completed through the Platform.

sections.title: Intellectual Property
sections.summary: Ownership of platform IP, user-generated content, and licence rights.

clauses.heading: Platform intellectual property
content: All Intellectual Property Rights in the Platform, including software code, interface designs, workflow frameworks, and documentation, remain the exclusive property of Blackwellen Ltd or our licensors. No rights are granted to you other than those necessary to access and use the Platform in accordance with these Terms. You must not reverse engineer, decompile, or create derivative works from our software except where permitted by law and only after providing us with prior written notice.

Fixnado grants users a revocable, non-exclusive, non-transferable licence to access the Platform for legitimate business purposes. Any feedback or suggestions you provide regarding improvements to the Platform may be used by us without obligation or restriction.

clauses.heading: User-generated content
content: Content you upload, including images, certificates, proposals, and chat messages, remains your property. You grant Fixnado a worldwide, royalty-free licence to host, process, and display that content to the extent necessary to provide the Platform. You warrant that any content uploaded does not infringe third-party rights and complies with applicable law. We may remove content that breaches these warranties or that is required to be removed under a court order.

Where a Work Order involves design services or bespoke documentation, ownership and licence terms between client and Provider should be recorded in the Work Order. Fixnado bears no responsibility for disputes over intellectual property between those parties.

sections.title: Data Protection and Privacy
sections.summary: Commitments aligned with the UK GDPR, Data Protection Act 2018, and PECR.

clauses.heading: Data controller roles
content: Fixnado acts as an independent data controller for Account data, Platform analytics, and compliance records. For certain features, such as managed messaging or dispute resolution, we may operate as a joint controller with Providers or clients. Each party is responsible for ensuring lawful processing grounds, transparency notices, and the exercise of data subject rights.

Where Fixnado processes personal data on behalf of a client or Provider (for example, storing project documents), our Data Processing Addendum applies. It incorporates the UK International Data Transfer Addendum to the EU Commission Standard Contractual Clauses where transfers to third countries occur.

clauses.heading: Security and retention
content: We maintain ISO 27001-aligned security controls, including encryption in transit and at rest, vulnerability management, and continuous monitoring. Access to personal data is role-based and logged. In the event of a personal data breach likely to result in a risk to individuals, we will notify affected parties without undue delay and cooperate with investigations by the Information Commissioner’s Office.

Personal data is retained only for as long as necessary to meet contractual obligations, statutory record-keeping requirements, or legitimate business interests. Typical retention periods are six years for contractual documentation and seven years for financial records, subject to extensions where litigation is reasonably anticipated.

items: Data subject requests can be submitted via privacy@fixnado.co.uk and will be acknowledged within two Business Days.
Marketing communications require explicit opt-in and may be withdrawn at any time through Account settings.

sections.title: Confidentiality
sections.summary: Obligations to keep commercially sensitive information secure.

clauses.heading: Mutual confidentiality
content: Each party agrees to keep Confidential Information obtained through the Platform confidential and to use it only for fulfilling Work Orders or complying with these Terms. Confidential Information includes pricing, bid strategies, technical documentation, site plans, personal data, and any proprietary know-how. Disclosure is permitted to professional advisers, subcontractors, or employees who need to know the information for legitimate purposes and who are bound by equivalent confidentiality obligations.

The confidentiality obligations do not apply to information that is public through no fault of the receiving party, was lawfully known before disclosure, or must be disclosed by law or competent authority. Where disclosure is required by law, the receiving party should, to the extent legally permissible, notify the disclosing party in advance.

clauses.heading: Technical safeguards
content: Parties must implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to protect Confidential Information, including secure storage, encryption, and access controls. Providers using shared devices must ensure that downloads are removed after use and that only authorised personnel can access Fixnado dashboards. Clients with multi-site portfolios should implement least-privilege access controls within their organisations.

sections.title: Liability and Risk Allocation
sections.summary: Limitations and exclusions of liability to maintain a fair balance between parties.

clauses.heading: Liability exclusions
content: Nothing in these Terms limits or excludes liability for death or personal injury caused by negligence, fraud, fraudulent misrepresentation, or any other liability that cannot be limited or excluded under English law. Subject to the foregoing, Fixnado is not liable for indirect, consequential, or special damages, loss of profits, loss of data, or loss of business opportunity arising from your use of the Platform or services procured through it.

Fixnado’s total aggregate liability arising out of or in connection with these Terms, whether in contract, tort (including negligence), breach of statutory duty, or otherwise, is limited to the greater of (a) £50,000 and (b) the total Service Fees paid by you to Fixnado in the 12 months preceding the event giving rise to the claim.

clauses.heading: Force majeure
content: Neither party is liable for failure or delay in performing obligations caused by events beyond its reasonable control, including acts of God, extreme weather, pandemics, cyberattacks, power outages, industrial disputes, or government action. The affected party must notify the other as soon as practicable and take reasonable steps to mitigate the impact. If a force majeure event prevents performance for more than 30 days, either party may terminate the affected Work Order without liability (save for payment for work already performed).

sections.title: Risk Management and Safety
sections.summary: Safety-first expectations for site works and incident management.

clauses.heading: Site safety
content: Providers must comply with site safety rules, including personal protective equipment requirements, hot works permits, lone worker policies, and safeguarding obligations where works occur in schools, care homes, or domestic premises. Clients must inform Providers of site-specific rules and provide inductions before work commences.

If a safety incident occurs, the Provider must make the area safe, notify emergency services if required, and inform Fixnado within one hour. Incident reports, including photographs and witness statements, must be uploaded to the Platform within 24 hours. Fixnado may convene a safety review panel to assess root causes and recommend remedial actions.

sections.title: Suspension and Termination
sections.summary: How and when accounts or Work Orders may be suspended or terminated.

clauses.heading: Suspension
content: We may suspend Account access immediately where we reasonably suspect a breach of these Terms, non-payment of Service Fees, security compromises, or behaviour that endangers safety. Suspension may involve pausing new bookings, hiding listings, or revoking API credentials. We will provide written notice explaining the reasons and outlining steps required for reinstatement.

During suspension, you must cease representing yourself as an active Fixnado Provider or referring to Fixnado-backed guarantees. Any ongoing Work Orders should be completed to avoid adverse impacts on clients.

clauses.heading: Termination
content: Either party may terminate these Terms for convenience by giving 30 days’ written notice, provided all outstanding Work Orders are completed or transferred to other Providers to the client’s satisfaction. We may terminate immediately if you materially breach these Terms and fail to remedy the breach within seven days of written notice, become insolvent, enter administration, or if continuing the relationship would breach law or regulatory obligations.

Upon termination, your licence to use the Platform ends. You must settle all outstanding fees, return or delete Confidential Information, and cooperate with data portability requests permitted under law. Provisions that by their nature should survive termination (including confidentiality, intellectual property, liability, and dispute resolution clauses) continue in force.

sections.title: Changes to the Platform or These Terms
sections.summary: Process for updates, notifications, and acceptance of new terms.

clauses.heading: Updating the Platform
content: Fixnado continually enhances the Platform, including deploying new automation, analytics, and compliance features. We may update user interfaces, workflows, or technical requirements with minimal notice where improvements do not materially reduce functionality. For material changes—such as retiring a module or altering integration endpoints—we aim to provide at least 45 days’ notice via in-app alerts and email.

You are responsible for ensuring your systems remain compatible with updated APIs or export formats. We provide sandbox environments and technical documentation to support integrations. Failure to implement updates may result in degraded performance for which Fixnado is not liable.

clauses.heading: Changes to these Terms
content: We may revise these Terms to reflect legal developments, product enhancements, or changes in business practices. Updates will be published on our website with the effective date clearly stated. Where changes are material, we will provide at least 30 days’ notice to registered users via email. Continued use of the Platform after the effective date constitutes acceptance of the updated Terms.

If you do not agree to a material change, you may terminate your Account before the effective date. In that scenario, outstanding Work Orders should be completed, and we will continue to process data in accordance with the previous Terms for a reasonable wind-down period unless law requires otherwise.

sections.title: Governing Law, Jurisdiction, and Complaints
sections.summary: Legal framework governing these Terms and how to raise complaints.

clauses.heading: Governing law and jurisdiction
content: These Terms, and any dispute or claim (including non-contractual disputes or claims) arising out of or in connection with them or their subject matter, are governed by the law of England and Wales. The courts of England and Wales have exclusive jurisdiction to settle any dispute or claim arising out of or in connection with these Terms. Nothing prevents Fixnado from seeking injunctive relief in any jurisdiction to protect our Intellectual Property Rights or Confidential Information.

clauses.heading: Complaints handling
content: We are committed to resolving complaints quickly and fairly. If you wish to make a complaint, please submit full details via legal@fixnado.co.uk or by post to the address listed in these Terms. We will acknowledge receipt within two Business Days and aim to provide a substantive response within ten Business Days. Complex matters may take longer; if so, we will keep you informed of progress.

If a dispute is not resolved through our internal process, we may agree to mediation using the Centre for Effective Dispute Resolution (CEDR) or another accredited mediator. Mediation does not affect your statutory rights or the right to commence court proceedings.

clauses.heading: Entire agreement
content: These Terms, together with any documents referred to in them, constitute the entire agreement between you and Fixnado regarding the Platform and supersede all prior understandings, agreements, representations, and warranties, both written and oral. You acknowledge that you have not relied on any statement, promise, or representation made or given by or on behalf of Fixnado that is not set out in these Terms, save that this does not exclude liability for fraudulent misrepresentation.

clauses.heading: Assignment and subcontracting
content: You may not assign, transfer, or subcontract any of your rights or obligations under these Terms without our prior written consent. Fixnado may assign its rights and obligations to an Affiliate or to a successor in connection with a merger, acquisition, or corporate reorganisation, provided that such assignment does not materially adversely affect your rights. We will notify you of any assignment that impacts service delivery.

No failure or delay by Fixnado in exercising any right or remedy provided under these Terms or by law constitutes a waiver of that or any other right or remedy, nor does it prevent or restrict any further exercise of that or any other right or remedy.

clauses.heading: Notices
content: Formal notices under these Terms must be in writing and delivered by hand, pre-paid first-class post, or email to the contact details specified in your Account or in the contact section of these Terms. Notices delivered by hand take effect immediately; by first-class post, on the second Business Day after posting; and by email.

clauses.heading: Severability
content: If any provision of these Terms is held invalid, unlawful, or unenforceable by a court or competent authority, that provision shall be deemed deleted. The remainder of the Terms remains in full force, and, where possible, the invalid provision shall be replaced with a valid provision that most closely reflects the original intent.
